Post:
"I'm always feeling down, like I'm stuck in a rut that I can't escape. No matter what I do, I just can't seem to shake off this darkness. It's like it's a part of me, a constant companion that I can't ever get rid of. And the worst part is, I don't even know why I feel this way. It's like there's this voice in my head that's always telling me that I'm not good enough, that I'll never be good enough. It's exhausting, and sometimes I just want to give up. But I can't, because I have to keep going for my family, for my friends, for myself. So I put on a fake smile and pretend like everything is okay, even though it's not. And that's the hardest part of all - feeling like I'm living a lie, like I'm trapped in this never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. But I know I can't give up, no matter how hard it gets. I have to keep fighting, for myself and for those who care about me."

* The transferred post also includes a question asking if others are feeling lost and alone in this messed up world, indicating a desire for social support and connection.
